english: to give up; abandon; discard; let go

etymology.description: 舍: phonetic 余 + semantic 口 (余 originally wrote this word; 口 was later added to distinguish). 捨: semantic 扌 “hand” + phonetic 舍.
etymology.interpretation: In 舍, 余 provides the sound and once served as the original graph, with 口 later added as a semantic hint and to differentiate forms. When 扌 is added to form 捨, the hand radical marks a manual action of dropping or relinquishing while 舍 supplies the pronunciation, yielding the sense “to give up/abandon.”
etymology.simplification: Traditional 捨 was simplified to 舍 by dropping the hand radical 扌 and reusing the phonetic base; the verb sense merged into 舍 to reduce strokes and unify forms.

examples.chinese: 我不舍得丢掉这本书(我不捨得丟掉這本書)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bù shěde diūdiào zhè běn shū.
examples.english: I can’t bear to give up this book.

examples.chinese: 为了孩子，他愿意舍己为人(為了孩子，他願意捨己為人)。
examples.pinyin: Wèile háizi, tā yuànyì shě jǐ wèi rén.
examples.english: For the sake of the children, he is willing to sacrifice himself for others.

examples.chinese: 她学会了放手舍弃过去的包袱(她學會了放手捨棄過去的包袱)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xuéhuì le fàngshǒu shěqì guòqù de bāofu.
examples.english: She learned to let go and abandon the burdens of the past.
